[LOGIC]: Sudden shifts in topic without clear transitions
[STRUCTURE]: Lack of clear progression in argument or narrative

[GRAMMAR]: "We however who have witnessed the succession of economic crises which attend and follow a great war ought not to forget..." (awkward phrasing and incorrect word order)
"the light taxes were raised with an ease." (missing article and awkward phrasing)
[SYNTAX]: "It had the double effect of pauperising the rural labourer and of putting an artificial premium on large families--the children who were carted off in waggon-loads to feed the factories." (cumbersome and confusing sentence structure)
[LEXICON]: "the famous system of doles out of the rates, in augmentation of wages" (awkward phrasing and unclear meaning)

[LOGIC]: The transition from discussing the war's impact on intellectual life to the condition of the working class is abrupt and lacks a clear connection.
The final paragraph about progress and Macaulay's examples is disconnected from the earlier discussion of famine and social conditions.
[STRUCTURE]: The paragraph about the famine and the "doles out of the rates" is disjointed and lacks a clear progression of ideas.
[CLARITY]: The reference to "the similar expedients of the last three years" is unclear without context.
[TRANSITION]: The shift from discussing over-population to discussing family size and social ambition is abrupt and lacks a smooth transition.
